links.title: The 5 Coolest Mobility Management CEOs
links.description: The chief executive officer (CEO) is at the top of the food chain within a company. The CEO undertakes many responsibilities, such as conceiving a strategy and direction and setting the precedent for their business' principles, conduct, and culture. The chief executive is also responsible for building an executive leadership team and allocating funds to match the company's goals and priorities.

source.name: Best Mobility Management Vendors, MDM Software and EMM Platforms

links.title: Geekbench benchmark hints at new MacBook Pro with 28W Intel CPU on the way
links.description: A Geekbench benchmark has surfaced that appears to reveal an upcoming MacBook Pro revamp. Note that Geekbench scores can be fabricated relatively easily, so this isn't confirmation of an imminent revamp - but it's certainly fuel on the fire. The new MacBookPro15,2 model features an Intel Core i7-8559U Coffee Lake CPU.

messages.body: $AAPL  Apple's new macOS Mojave optimizes the Mac for iOS users, not PC switchers: https://appleinsider.com/articles/18/07/02/apples-new-macos-mojave-optimizes-the-mac-for-ios-users-not-pc-switchers

links.title: Apple's new macOS Mojave optimizes the Mac for iOS users, not PC switchers
links.description: Many industry pundits have fixated on how Macs are going to somehow merge with iOS, or seem to be confused about whether Apple wants PC buyers to upgrade to a Mac or an iPad. Some suggest the answer is a cheap Mac or macOS netbook.

links.description: Hi everyone! Decided to try out a new format for videos, tell me what you think! I apologize for the slow uploading, but with a new job thats ~30 hrs/week, I'm often too tired to write/record, just give me some time to figure things out :) As always, this is not financial advice, just my thoughts and opinions!
